body.p:
we have lived through the heat so far the heat has been bad enoughf enough but i could have born it but i have had a real bad time with the rheumatism last saturday Saturday toward evening i went up on the hill i went by the way of cumberland st Cumberland Street and set down several times before i reached the top whether it was that or what i dont don't know but all that night i couldent couldn't sleep my legs pained me so very bad and sunday but tuesday Tuesday they dident didn't pain me so bad but left me pretty lame but i have kept around slowly made edd doo do all i could i suppose it was coming
down the hill strained the nerves so i think i shant shan't go on fort green Fort Greene again i am well otherways but such pain as i had for two or three days) and to mend the matter i had one of mr heyde s heyde's complimentory complimentary letters over a sheet of foolscap i read part of it and kindled the fire with it) walt if Mrs Oconor O'Connor and Jenney comes i will make them very welcome and treat them very kindly but i cant can't doo do as if i wasent wasn't lame but i shall get along very well it dont don't hurt me so bad quite to day to walk as it did yesterday) george hasent hasn't been home in a long while i havent haven't heard a word from him he said if i got out of money i must write to him but i aint ain't out yet i have felt sometimes quite uneasy about him as he is liable to be affected with the sun and he had to go to florence Florence to inspect the new york New York pipe) matty is not or wasent wasn't the last i heard so well she and the children talked of going to minnesotaMinnesota the children has had the whooping coughf cough and they dont don't seem to get over it

postscript.p: Walt you must keep a good heart that teedious tedious thumb will come all right i hope
